item.title: "This is like Sheriff Elder hanging a sign on the jail...
item.content:encoded:
ACLU of Colorado

"This is like Sheriff Elder hanging a sign on the jail saying, ‚ÄòPlease sue me,'‚Äù said Mark Silverstein, legal director of the ACLU of Colorado. ‚ÄúAnd I imagine someone will accept that invitation.‚Äù

The more than 1,200 inmates inside the El Paso County jail on any given day were not provided masks until last week, when the jail became the site of Colorado‚Äôs second-largest coronavirus out‚Ä¶

denverpost.com

El Paso County jail inmates weren‚Äôt given masks prior to one of Colorado‚Äôs largest COVID-19 outbreaks

item.title: Yesterday Denver City Council approved a $500,000 budget for the...
item.content:encoded:
ACLU of Colorado

Yesterday Denver City Council approved a $500,000 budget for the Denver Immigrant Legal Services Fund ‚Äî a program that helps provide immigration attorney services to those facing deportation and separation from their families. Thank you, Denver City Council.

Colorado Immigrant Rights Coalition - CIRC

üéâüéâüéâ
Having access to an immigration attorney is life changing for Denver families and all the more critical during this economic crisis and the increased COVID-19 outbreaks that the Aurora GEO immigration detention facility.

item.title: Dystopian technology meets mass incarceration. Read why we must...
item.content:encoded:
ACLU of Colorado

Dystopian technology meets mass incarceration. Read why we must stop the spread of risk assessment tools ‚Äì where a computer tries to predict your behavior ‚Äì and decides whether or not you stay in jail. These tools make too many mistakes. Read more: https://bit.ly/2G5RqyK

item.title: Watch the Free Them All vigil happening now at the GEO...
item.content:encoded:
ACLU of Colorado

Watch the Free Them All vigil happening now at the GEO immigration detention facility in Aurora.

AFSC & Coloradans For Immigrant Rights was live.

***seguido por espa√±ol***
#COVID19 threatens the lives of everyone imprisoned, with outbreaks in more than two dozen carceral setting in Colorado right now. We ...know #DetentionIsDeadly and the only safe course of action for people in cages, the workers at those facilities and the #publichealth is to #FreeThemAll.
*** #COVID19 representa una amenaza a toda nuestra gente encarcelada. Colorado se encuentra con brotes en mas de dos docenas en lugares carcelarios ahora mismo. Sabemos que la detenci√≥n es mortal y que el √∫nico curso de acci√≥n seguro, tanto para las personas en jaulas, los trabajadores en estos lugares y la #saludpublica es liberarlos a todos.

Immigration and Customs Enforcement‚Äôs decision to return to business as usual and the GEO detention center in Aurora are not keeping our community safe. Experts like Dr. Carlos Franco Paredes are calling for compassionate humanitarian release of all imprisoned people. Tonight, we will hear from loved ones of those jailed, impacted individuals and the Immigrant Freedom Fund of Colorado about how your donations can free our people!
***La decisi√≥n de la migra de regresar a operativos ‚Äúnormales‚Äù conjunto con como GEO maneja su centro de detenci√≥n, ponen en peligro la seguridad de nuestra comunidad. Expertos como Dr. Carlos Paredes est√°n clamando por una liberaci√≥n humanitaria de todas las personas encarceladas. ¬°Esta noche escucharemos de los seres queridos de la gente aprisionada, de personas detenidas y del Fondo de Liberaci√≥n de Inmigrantes en Colorado sobre como sus donativos pueden rescatar a nuestra gente!

This event is brought to you by the American Friends Service Committee, the Colorado People‚Äôs Alliance, the Colorado Freedom Fund AND the Immigrant Freedom Fund of Colorado.
****Este evento es patrocinado por el Comit√© de Servicio de los Amigos Americanos en Colorado, Colorado People‚Äôs Alliance, Colorado Freedom Fund Y TAMBIEN el Immigrant Freedom Fund of Colorado.

item.title: Pretrial risk assessment tools are built using biased policing...
item.content:encoded:
ACLU of Colorado

Pretrial risk assessment tools are built using biased policing and criminal legal data steeped in structural racism. Cloaking a broken system behind an aura of technology and objectivity doesn‚Äôt make it right. If we want a more just system we must do better than relying on pretrial RATS.
https://bit.ly/3n8e9KC

Let‚Äôs start with a theoretical scenario: Al Capone and Mother Theresa are both arrested and charged with committing murder. Based on that charge, bond is set at $5 million for each of them. Given what we know about them, who do you think would be seen as a lower risk to the community if released? ...

boulderweekly.com

Analyzing the risk - Boulder Weekly

Let‚Äôs start with a theoretical scenario: Al Capone and Mother Theresa are both arrested and charged with committing murder. Based on that charge, bond is set at $5 million for each of them. Given what we know about them, who do you think would be seen as a lower risk to the community if released? ...Let‚Äôs start with a theoretical scenario: Al Capone and Mother Theresa are both arrested and charged with committing murder. Based on that charge, bond is set at $5 million for each of them. Given what we know about them, who do you think would be seen as a lower risk to the community if released? ...

item.title: It's morally abhorrent to deprive a presumptively innocent...
item.content:encoded:
ACLU of Colorado

It's morally abhorrent to deprive a presumptively innocent person of their pretrial liberty based on a concern they might get a traffic ticket or fail to show up in court. Yet that's what happens in CO every day when judges use risk assessment tools. https://bit.ly/2G5RqyK

item.title: "The goal of any democratic election is to represent the...
item.content:encoded:
ACLU of Colorado

"The goal of any democratic election is to represent the will of the people ‚Äî not the politicians. To achieve that goal, we must count every single vote otherwise our elections count for nothing. Let‚Äôs accept an extended election process and ensure the votes of the American people ‚Äî all the people ‚Äî are respected." - ACLU of Colorado Voting Rights Campaign Coordinator Jen Samano

In an unprecedented year, it‚Äôs only natural that we have an unprecedented election. While many of us may have wished for the relief of knowing the results on election night, this time it may take d‚Ä¶

denverpost.com

Guest Commentary: Voters decide the winners

item.title: Once again, Coloradans have made it clear that private medical...
item.content:encoded:
ACLU of Colorado

Once again, Coloradans have made it clear that private medical decisions should be made without political interference. There is nothing reasonable about restricting access to essential medical care ‚Äî not now, not ever. #NoOn115 https://bit.ly/3l3AEQ8

Reproductive rights advocates said Proposition 115 would have been devastating for people seeking abortions in Colorado and around the country.

huffpost.com

Colorado Rejects Ballot Initiative Seeking To Ban Abortion Later In Pregnancy

item.title: Amendment 76 was brought to Colorado‚Äôs ballot by Florida...
item.content:encoded:
ACLU of Colorado

Amendment 76 was brought to Colorado‚Äôs ballot by Florida politicians who wanted to use Colorado as a guinea pig to give power to an anti-immigrant agenda. Colorado already had a citizenship requirement for voting. Despite this loss, we will continue to work hard to make voting accessible to every citizen. Thank you to everyone who canvassed, made calls, made videos, texted and talked to friends and family about why Amendment 76 was wrong for Colorado. We won‚Äôt stop until we rejoin the 48 other states that value voting rights for young people and immigrants. We are not defeated, we simply have more work to do.

Vote No on 76

See our statement at www.votenoon76.com (link in bio)

See the results and other info about the 2020 US Election. See Election Results
item.author: ACLU of Colorado

item.title: Nearly everyone will need to take time to care for themselves, a...
item.content:encoded:
ACLU of Colorado

Nearly everyone will need to take time to care for themselves, a newborn baby, or a seriously ill family member at some point, but 4 out of 5 Coloradans don‚Äôt have access to paid family and medical leave. Thanks to Proposition 118 passing more Coloradans can finally put their families first without having to risk losing their job.

Yes On 118: Colorado Families First
item.author: ACLU of Colorado
